Comments_List: Close reading, critical thinking, specific writing

The course was a good introduction to an incredibly broad sweep of modern literature, and there was a good mix of texts in translation as well as texts in their own language. The course followed the development of ideas in literature.
Critical thinking skills and the ability to bs seminar discussion with a minor knowledge of a text acquired by rapid skimming.
2 or 3 fewer books, so to engage with the better 8 or 9 books for longer.
I would love it if there were a theme we could follow, or a guiding principle, like how love or morals or something like that evolves through time.
The course is very demanding and engaging, of course. I feel like the faculty has done a great job!
Its tough but fair. Please get rid of Proust.
I loved the literature, but honestly it's just too much to adequately cover in a semester.
Yes, if that's what you're interested in :)
Only if they are a masochist.
If you're a skilled reader, go for it. I simply wasn't satisfied with the depth at which I was able to engage each work.
